Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2011 01:14PM phan wrote: After my excisional biopsy, I needed to wear a bra 24 hours a day for a week (except showering) I was told not to wear an underwire because it would rub against where my incision was. The pain was minimal and I didn't need the tylenol with codeine prescribed to me. Couldn't exercise for a while, no heavy lifting and no bending over to pick up things. After about 2 weeks, I was back to normal.
Posts.Title: Embarrasing question- but need to ask. GmaFoley barbe1958

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2011 10:12AM phan wrote: Hi OJulie 67, I had 3 areas of microcalcifications which was found on a mammogram Dec. 17th. Went back for magnification (Briads 4c) and was told I needed a stereotactic biopsy. Had the 3 areas biopsied in January. Two came back benign and the third was diagnosed as Atypical Ductal Hyperplasia. I had surgery last Wednesday to have it removed (wire localization and excisonal biopsy).  It came back totally benign. I know what you are going through, but take comfort that most of these are benign.
Posts.Title: Cluster calcifications found on mammogram OJulie67 gill27
